oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Monthly return of public animals, wagons, harness, and other means of transportation

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed Form No. 5 includes categories for horses; mules; oxen; wagons; ambulances; carts; ships; schooners; sloops; steamers; boats and barges; and skiffs and batteaux in the possession of William Alonzo Wainwright, Assistant Quartermaster, Nashville, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Alonzo Wainwright rose in rank from 1st Lieutenant to Brevet Major, spending approximately a year and a half as Assistant Quartermaster in charge of the Taylor Depot in Nashville, then taking charge of the advance depot established in Knoxville in 1865. When the Knoxville depot and offices closed in 1869, Wainwright transferred to Brownsville, Texas, where he retired from service in 1870. Following his army career, he returned to his home and hardware business in Noblesville, Indiana.
